In the central area with the Ark, Shliemann and the other Nazis wait impatiently, eyeing the Ark with some discomfo Belloq is not visible, because at the moment he is - In the folds of the Tabernacle, the silk of the tents  undulating around him. text: Hold it. (the Nazi react) One move from anybody and I blow  that box back to Moses.
Shliemann makes it clear to the other Nazis that Indy is be obeyed.
Jones, your persistence surprises  even me. You are going to give  mercenaries a bad name.
What about you? Talked to God yet? (Belloq's eyes flash) Where's the girl?
Doctor Jones, surely you don't think  you can escape from this base.
That depends on how reasonable we're  all willing to be. All I want is the  girl. We'll keep possession of the  Ark only till we've got safe transport  to England. Then it's all yours.
If we refuse?
Then the Ark and some of us are going  up in a big bang. I don't think Hitler  would like that a bit. Now I don't  want to talk about this anymore.  Show me that girl in five seconds or -

The Tall Captain flies out of the silk and takes Indy dow by the neck. The bazooka clatters across the cement floor two other Nazis help subdue Indy. The three Nazis take In pistol from his holster and raise him roughly in their gr
Jones, this is the second time I  have seen you looking very foolish.
It's a bad habit. I'm trying to break  it.
Shliemann draws his Luger.
I'll help you. This time I'll kill  you myself.
Shliemann raises the pistol.
No! Not in the presence of the Ark!  Take him outside.
Shliemann eyes Belloq, then the Ark. He lowers the pistol motions for the Nazis to take Indy out ahead of him. They stop a moment only when Belloq speaks.

text: Indiana Jones, I salute you. I am  even a little sorry you will miss  this moment.
Thanks. If you talk to Him, tell Him  I'm on my way up.
Shliemann motions them out and follows. Belloq turns back the Ark, raising the ivory rod.

Shliemann, the Tall Captain, Indy and the two Nazis holdi him emerge from the Tabernacle. Shliemann points to a nea wall and the group starts that way with Shliemann and the Tall Captain slightly ahead.

Belloq has the ivory rod inserted in the notch under the of the Ark. He utters a short phrase in Hebrew and begins press down on his end of the rod. The lid of the Ark begi to lift. It's difficult work. Belloq puts his whole weigh into one big press on his end and the lid opens two feet. Inside the Ark of the Covenant is a preview of the end of the world. A light so bright, a power so fearsome, a char so jolting, that there is nothing in our world to compare it. It's as though this magnificent golden box has been  gathering electric energy for three thousand years, waiti for just this crack of the lid to release it all in one f cleansing explosion of pure force. Blinding arcs of light shoot out across the Tabernacle  instantly killing all the Nazis inside and turning the wh silk to flame. But it is Belloq in his obsession who take the full blast. His whole body seems lit by a million vol current and, for a moment, his complete form is white, th blue, then maybe green, but it is hard to tell because ou eyes are blinded now too. Two aspects of this ghastly,  beautiful display are somehow communicated in the chaos,  although the communication is subliminal. First, that Bel in the instant of his destruction, has experienced some k of sublime, transcendental knowledge. If a death's-head c smile and look satisfied, that is how Belloq's incandesce face would be described. Secondly, this event is accompan by a sound like no other. A sound so intense and so odd a so haunting that the suggestible among us might imagine i were the whisper of God.

At the machine gun post, the Nazi Sentry has been firing  like crazy, but now there is terror in his eyes. He reali the car is not going to stop. He lacks faith in his  stronghold. Too late. The mine car smashes into the seed bag bunker. And right through. The Nazi Sentry, his machine gun and a dozen bur seed bags are slammed into the ocean in a wild, hurtling  mass. text: Fire. Everywhere. No sign of life. A large gaping doorway flames ringing it, blazing into the room beyond. Hanging one hinge there, its metal blasted and jagged, is a heavy door with the signed lettering, in German, "DANGER -  MUNITIONS". The first explosion happens. It's a baby compared to what coming yet it rocks the earth. It's terrible. And then, a immediately, another. The long, irregular, ever larger ch of explosions begins.
sense_profile: The long , irregular , ever larger ch of explosions

text: The island rumbles and shakes. From fissures and small na caves, dirt and rock shoot out like spraying water. Still the explosion continue. A huge chunk of white cliff falls away into the turbulent sea. Birds scream and soar, afrai to land. Finally, we settle on a full shot of the island. We can  recognize that the small opening high on the slope from w a cloud of smoke and dust is billowing is the end of the  mine tunnel. And there below it, quite small from this  distance is the dock. And the boat that looks like a Gree fishing boat. There can be no mistake even from this far  away - the boat is chugging out to sea.

text: Indy, Brody, and Marion, looking very stylish, are seated Colonel Musgrove's huge office. Sun pours in a window, th which Washington can be seen sparkling across the Potomac Everything is neat and clean and regular. Including the t men who are arrayed around the office. Two we know - Col. Musgrove and Maj. Eaton. The third is an unnamed Bureaucr He hangs back, smiling and genial, his features obscured the glare of the window. He doesn't say anything, yet you have a sense that the others defer to him in the matter a hand. He is the essence of all that is Byzantine and  inscrutable in our scrubbed government machine. Indy and Brody are dissatisfied with the way the meeting gone. Marion, on the other hand, is very happy and eager get out of there. Eaton's manner is irritatingly cheery.
You've done your country a great  service.
And we trust you found the settlement  satisfactory?
Quite.
Good, good. (glances around at  the others) Then I guess that about does it.
When can we have the Ark?
Eaton's glance flicks over to the mysterious Bureaucrat,  then back to Brody.
I thought we answered that. It's  someplace very safe -
(heated) That's a powerful force. Research  should be done -
Oh, it will be, Dr. Jones, I assure  you. We have top men working on it  right now.
Who?
Top men.
Indy exchanges a look with Brody.
We may be able to help.
We appreciate that. And we won't  hesitate to call on you.
(dismissing them) Thank you all. Thank you again.
Indy looks them over coldly. He gets up, sullen.
Indy, Brody and Marion emerge from the building. Brody bi them farewell and moves off in another direction. Marion  clings to Indy's arm in an energetic, very feminine way,  scolding him.
Well they aren't going to tell you,  so why don't you just forget it. I'd  think you'd had enough of that damn  Ark. Just put your mind on something  else.
Indy stops, looking across the river, his mind occupied.
Yeah, like what?
Marion makes a face, then puts her arms around his neck a plants a humdinger of a kiss on his mouth. It goes on a w Finally they break.
It's not the Ark... but it'll have  to do.
They move down the steps, smiling.
The Ark of the Covenant sits in a wooden crate. A wooden comes down and hides it from view. The lid is solidly nai to the crate as we read the stenciled message on top -
The hammering is completed and hands shift the heavy crat onto a dolly.

text: A Little Old Government Warehouseman begins pushing the c Ark down as aisle. Soon we see that the aisle is formed b huge stacks or crates. They come in many shapes and sizes but when it comes right down to it, they all look like th one that holds the Ark. All have markings like the messag we've just seen. Pretty soon we're far enough and high en away from the Little Old Government Warehouseman to see t this is one of the biggest rooms in the world. And it is  full. Crates and crates. All looking alike. All gathering dust. And then we notice that the Little Old Government  Warehouseman, pushing his new crate ahead of him, has tur into another aisle and disappeared from view.
